title: The firm using online yoga and baking to boost staff morale
description: Accountants MKS has laid on a wide array of activities on Zoom to keep staff spirits high while working from home.

title: Coronation Street filming resumes after 11 weeks in lockdown
description: Filming, with special measures in place, has resumed on Coronation Street, 11 weeks after it was stopped because of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: 'I will have to rely on my husband for the first time'
description: Working parents face having to drop out of work or reduce their hours due to extended school closures.

title: Gone with the Wind removed from HBO Max
description: The service says the 1939 film will return alongside a "discussion of its historical context".

title: Indigenous Australian deaths in custody: 'Why I’m fighting for my uncle'
description: Kyah Patten says she hopes Black Lives Matter momentum will force a review into her uncle’s 1981 death.

title: £7,000 holiday refund stress 'is making me ill’
description: Customers are waiting months for refunds which should arrive in 14 days.

title: Coronavirus: Five unanswered questions on the travel quarantine rules
description: Travellers to the UK now have to self-isolate for 14 days. But how will the rules work in practice?

title: Rapper Wretch 32's father Tasered by London police
description: The rapper says there has been a lack of progression on "police brutality" in the UK.

title: No crowd noise to drown the winces of pain - boxing is back, but not as we know it
description: Boxing returns to Las Vegas' MGM Grand as undefeated American Shakur Stevenson stops Felix Caraballo in the sixth round.

title: Coronavirus came to UK 'on at least 1,300 separate occasions'
description: There was no one 'patient zero' that started the UK epidemic, research shows.

title: George Floyd protests: What do 'thug' 'white privilege' and 'ally' mean?
description: Protests following the death of George Floyd have brought some important phrases into the spotlight.

title: Facebook removes The Specials singer's page 'over skinhead links'
description: Neville Staple was "astounded" when his profile vanished after being wrongly associated with racism.

title: Anxiety over plans for next year's exams, MPs told
description: Uncertainty about schools and exams is creating a tsunami of anxiety among England's pupils, MPs hear.

title: Thousands of UK jobs go in sweeping retail closures
description: The owners of Frankie and Benny's, Monsoon Accessorize and Quiz are restructuring their businesses.

title: William Gladstone: University of Liverpool to rename building over slavery links
description: A University of Liverpool building was named after William Gladstone who benefited from slavery.

title: My experience growing up mixed race in Plymouth
description: Evey Gordon performs a poem about her life as a mixed race child growing up in the South West.

title: Italian woman prepares olives during brain tumour operation
description: The 60 year old had a tumour removed as she stuffed 90 olives in an operating theatre.

title: Merseyside derby can be played at Goodison
description: The Merseyside derby gets the go-ahead to be held at Everton's Goodison Park stadium, while Liverpool can play home games at Anfield.

title: Olof Palme murder: Sweden believes it knows who killed PM in 1986
description: Prosecutors say Stig Engstrom, who killed himself in 2000, was the man who shot Olof Palme in 1986.

title: Chelsea to donate WSL prize money to domestic abuse charity
description: Champions Chelsea will give their WSL prize money to a charity which supports women and children experiencing domestic abuse.

title: Coronavirus: Call for UK-wide clap for key workers on NHS anniversary
description: People are being encouraged to join a "countrywide thank you" to key workers on 5 July.

title: Lewis Hamilton salutes 'positive steps' over racism
description: Lewis Hamilton salutes the "positive steps" taken in the fight against racism as a result of the global protests of the past two weeks.

title: 'Disappointing' progress on social mobility in England
description: The coronavirus crisis could destroy any gains made, the government watchdog says.

title: Sugababes star Keisha Buchanan opens up about experiences of racism
description: Keisha Buchanan fell victim to the trope of the "angry black woman" during her time in the band.

title: Coronavirus: NHS waiting list 'could hit 10 million this year'
description: Health leaders warn the coronavirus crisis will impact the number of people waiting for treatment.

title: When can I ride an e-scooter legally?
description: With people told to avoid public transport, the government's hoping to trial e-scooter rental schemes.

title: Coronavirus: Zoos and safari parks set to reopen from 15 June - PM
description: Boris Johnson is due to announce the move will be subject to distancing measures being in place.

title: Federer to miss rest of season after further knee operation
description: Roger Federer will miss the rest of the 2020 season after having a further operation on his right knee.

title: What you need to know as Spanish top flight resumes
description: It's tight at the top and the bottom - here's what to expect from the remainder of the Spanish season.

title: 'How my photo ended up breaking Android phones'
description: Gaurav Agrawal said the "magical evening" he captured last summer was never intended to cause harm.

title: The Papers: 'The lost generation' and 'toppling the past'
description: Wednesday's papers focus on plans for schools in England, and controversial public monuments.

title: Coronavirus: How are England's coastal resorts faring?
description: Will the effects of the coronavirus lockdown tip seaside towns into a terminal decline?

title: The teenage inventor on a mission
description: Freddie has won two prizes for his inventions designed to keep people safe at home.

title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: 'People think it's over, but it's not'
description: Dr John Wright of Bradford Royal Infirmary talks to two colleagues who haven't been home since the pandemic began.

title: Red Lion: Archaeologists 'find London's earliest theatre'
description: The Red Lion is thought to be the first purpose-built theatre created in the Elizabethan era.
